text: New store in the coffee shop. Herbal soup is very rich and flavorful. $5 for a big bowl of hand made noodles with pig liver and lean meat now a days where to find. many other ingredients to add on.

Patronised this new stall that offers mee hoon kueh & pork liver mee sua.

Got the mee sua as I was yearning for liver & soupy dish. Distinct, pleasant
herbal & peppery notes, warmth the body almost instantly. Thought this would be great on a rainy day.

Chilies, light & dark sauces, coriander & cutlery were displayed at the stall front to allow customers to help themselves. A delightful meal there, will return to try their mhk.
Handmade MHK is the way to go; the right size and texture! Moreover, the herbal soup was superb. It was fragrant and peppery at the same time. Highly recommendedüëçüèª

Solid hand made noodles. Even after having it almost 3-4 times a week, I still get dilemma on whether I should order soup or dry. Both versions are really good to be really honest. Uncle recently changed to onsen eggs as well so that‚Äôs 6 stars for me.

If you can't wait, don't come here for lunch, can take a while, even if they don't have many people. Portion is mini sized, also staff are inflexible. I had the liver mee sua soup, but the food was their only redemption. The boss and worker also have attitude problem. Order, then cook noodles need to check 3 times. I wonder where they gone wrong.
